title: Sugar Bowl Livestream: How to Watch Georgia vs. Notre Dame Quarterfinal Football Game Online
description: UPDATE: The Sugar Bowl has been postponed following an alleged terror attack in New Orleans early Wednesday. The game will be played Thursday evening, our sister site Deadline reports. Georgia and Notre Dame face off at the Sugar Bowl, in the College Football Playoff Quarterfinals. Here’s everything you need to know for streaming the Sugar […]
author: Claire Franken
excerpt: The Sugar Bowl kicks off at 8:45 pm ET Wednesday, Jan. 1 from New Orleans — here's how to stream the Georgia vs. Notre Dame football game online free.
text: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, TVLine may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. UPDATE: The Sugar Bowl has been postponed following an alleged terror attack in New Orleans early Wednesday. The game will be played Thursday evening, our sister site Deadline reports. Georgia and Notre Dame face off at the Sugar Bowl, in the College Football Playoff Quarterfinals. Here’s everything you need to know for streaming the Sugar Bowl online for free. How to Watch Georgie vs. Notre Dame Football Game Online The Georgia vs. Notre Dame quarterfinal college football game — aka the Sugar Bowl — kicks off at 8:45 pm ET on Wednesday, Jan. 1, and will be broadcast on ESPN. There are plenty of ways to watch ESPN online for free — you just need to find a platform that offers free trials. Below we’ve outlined all of the ways to watch the Sugar Bowl and listed which live-TV streaming services offer free trial periods for cost-free viewing. Using a free trial to watch the Sugar Bowl is your best way for watching Georgia vs. Notre Dame online free — simply cancel the subscription once the game is over! How to Watch the Sugar Bowl Online Free: Sling TV Sling TV is one of the most affordable cord-cutting options for accessing ESPN. The service offers three subscriptions with different channel lineups, but we recommend the Sling Orange plan for $40/month, since it includes ESPN. With Sling, you can’t watch the Sugar Bowl for free since there’s no free trial period. But if you act fast, you can subscribe to Sling for just $20 because the service is offering new users half off their first month! In terms of live-TV streaming services, this is the cheapest way to watch the Sugar Bowl online without cable. Courtesy of Sling TV Free Trial: N/A Price: $40/month $20/month Device Availability: AirTV, Amazon Fire TV, Android, Android TV, Apple TV, Chromecast, Cox, Google Nest, iOS, LG TV, Roku, Samsung TV, TiVo, Vizio, Windows 10, Windows 11, Xbox, Xfinity Channel Lineup: A&E, AMC, AXS TV, BBC America, BET, Bloomberg Television, Cartoon Network, Charge!, CNN, Comedy Central, Comet, Disney Channel, ESPN, ESPN2, ESPN3, Food Network, Freeform, Fuse, HGTV, History Channel, IFC, Investigation Discovery, Lifetime, Local Now, MGM+ Drive-In, MotorTrend, Nick Jr., QVC, TBS, TNT, Travel Channel, Vice How to Watch the Sugar Bowl Online Free: DirecTV Stream DirecTV Stream offers a five-day free trial so you can watch the Georgia vs. Notre Dame football game online for free! We recommend signing up for the Choice package, which includes ESPN. DirecTV is offering $20 off this plan for your first three months, bringing the cost down to $94.99/month. The subscription will automatically renew at its regular price of $114.99/month. But remember, you can watch the Sugar Bowl for free with this plan if you cancel the subscription before the five-day trial ends. Fubo has you covered. The live-TV streaming service offers new users a seven-day free trial and its Pro plan grants subscribers access to ESPN. Date, Start Time The 2025 Sugar Bowl game between the Georgia Bulldogs and Notre Dame Fighting Irish kicks off at 8:45 pm ET on Wednesday, Jan. 1. Whoever wins will move on to the semifinals, playing the winner of the Fiesta Bowl, either No. 3 Boise State or No. 6 Penn State for a chance to win the National Championship on Monday, Jan. 20. Georgia vs. Notre Dame Odds, Prediction It looks like it’s going to be a close one between No. 2 Georgia and No. 7 Notre Dame, with oddsmakers giving the Bulldogs a slight advantage in a -1.5 point spread. All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, TVLine may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes.

UPDATE: The Sugar Bowl has been postponed following an alleged terror attack in New Orleans early Wednesday. The game will be played Thursday evening, our sister site Deadline reports.

Georgia and Notre Dame face off at the Sugar Bowl, in the College Football Playoff Quarterfinals. Here’s everything you need to know for streaming the Sugar Bowl online for free.

How to Watch Georgie vs. Notre Dame Football Game Online

The Georgia vs. Notre Dame quarterfinal college football game — aka the Sugar Bowl — kicks off at 8:45 pm ET on Wednesday, Jan. 1, and will be broadcast on ESPN. There are plenty of ways to watch ESPN online for free — you just need to find a platform that offers free trials. Below we’ve outlined all of the ways to watch the Sugar Bowl and listed which live-TV streaming services offer free trial periods for cost-free viewing. Using a free trial to watch the Sugar Bowl is your best way for watching Georgia vs. Notre Dame online free — simply cancel the subscription once the game is over!

How to Watch the Sugar Bowl Online Free: Sling TV

Sling TV is one of the most affordable cord-cutting options for accessing ESPN. The service offers three subscriptions with different channel lineups, but we recommend the Sling Orange plan for $40/month, since it includes ESPN. With Sling, you can’t watch the Sugar Bowl for free since there’s no free trial period. But if you act fast, you can subscribe to Sling for just $20 because the service is offering new users half off their first month! In terms of live-TV streaming services, this is the cheapest way to watch the Sugar Bowl online without cable.

  • Free Trial: N/A
  • Price: $40/month $20/month
  • Device Availability: AirTV, Amazon Fire TV, Android, Android TV, Apple TV, Chromecast, Cox, Google Nest, iOS, LG TV, Roku, Samsung TV, TiVo, Vizio, Windows 10, Windows 11, Xbox, Xfinity
  • Channel Lineup: A&E, AMC, AXS TV, BBC America, BET, Bloomberg Television, Cartoon Network, Charge!, CNN, Comedy Central, Comet, Disney Channel, ESPN, ESPN2, ESPN3, Food Network, Freeform, Fuse, HGTV, History Channel, IFC, Investigation Discovery, Lifetime, Local Now, MGM+ Drive-In, MotorTrend, Nick Jr., QVC, TBS, TNT, Travel Channel, Vice

How to Watch the Sugar Bowl Online Free: DirecTV Stream

DirecTV Stream offers a five-day free trial so you can watch the Georgia vs. Notre Dame football game online for free! We recommend signing up for the Choice package, which includes ESPN. DirecTV is offering $20 off this plan for your first three months, bringing the cost down to $94.99/month. The subscription will automatically renew at its regular price of $114.99/month. But remember, you can watch the Sugar Bowl for free with this plan if you cancel the subscription before the five-day trial ends.

How to Watch the Sugar Bowl Online Free: Fubo TV

Looking for how to watch the Sugar Bowl for free? Fubo has you covered. The live-TV streaming service offers new users a seven-day free trial and its Pro plan grants subscribers access to ESPN. You get over 175 other channels — including the NFL Network and the CBS Sports Network — and the plan usually costs $79.99/month but is on sale for $30 off. More good news? You can cancel and change your plan at any time, making Fubo an easy and low-commitment way for watching the Sugar Bowl online for free.

When is the 2025 Sugar Bowl? Date, Start Time

The 2025 Sugar Bowl game between the Georgia Bulldogs and Notre Dame Fighting Irish kicks off at 8:45 pm ET on Wednesday, Jan. 1. Whoever wins will move on to the semifinals, playing the winner of the Fiesta Bowl, either No. 3 Boise State or No. 6 Penn State for a chance to win the National Championship on Monday, Jan. 20.

Georgia vs. Notre Dame Odds, Prediction

It looks like it’s going to be a close one between No. 2 Georgia and No. 7 Notre Dame, with oddsmakers giving the Bulldogs a slight advantage in a -1.5 point spread.
